ai-dn28:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā in Pāvārika’s mango grove.
ai-dn28:1.3_0: Then venerable Sāriputta approached the Fortunate One,
ai-dn28:1.3_2: While sitting on one side venerable Sāriputta said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-dn28:1.4_0: “Sir, I have such confidence in the Buddha that I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.”
ai-dn28:1.5_0: “That’s a grand and dramatic statement, Sāriputta. You’ve roared a definitive, categorical lion’s roar, saying:
ai-dn28:1.6_0: ‘Sir, I have such confidence in the Buddha that
ai-dn28:1.7_0: I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.’
ai-dn28:1.8_0: What about all the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who lived in the past? Have you comprehended their minds to know that
ai-dn28:1.9_0: those Buddhas had such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”
ai-dn28:1.11_0: “But have you, Sāriputta, understood those who live in the future after comprehending those perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who live in the future?
ai-dn28:1.12_0: those Buddhas will have such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom,
ai-dn28:1.12_3: those Fortunate Ones will have such and such liberations?”
ai-dn28:1.14_0: “And what about me, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha at present? Have you comprehended my mind to know that
ai-dn28:1.15_0: I have such ethics, or such teachings, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”
ai-dn28:1.17_0: “Well then, Sāriputta, given that you don’t comprehend the minds of Buddhas past, future, or present,
ai-dn28:1.18_0: what exactly are you doing, making such a grand and dramatic statement, roaring such a definitive, categorical lion’s roar?”
ai-dn28:1.19_0: I have such confidence in the Buddha that I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.”
ai-dn28:2.1_0: “Sir, though I don’t comprehend the minds of Buddhas past, future, and present,
ai-dn28:2.2_0: However, I understand (what I said) is in conformity with the Teaching.
ai-dn28:2.3_0: Suppose there was a king’s frontier citadel with fortified embankments, ramparts, and arches, and a single gate.
ai-dn28:2.4_0: And it has a gatekeeper who is astute, competent, and clever. He keeps strangers out and lets known people in.
ai-dn28:2.5_0: As he walks around the patrol path, he doesn’t see a hole or cleft in the wall, not even one big enough for a cat to slip out.
ai-dn28:2.7_0: ‘Whatever sizable creatures enter or leave the citadel, all of them do so via this gate.’
ai-dn28:2.8_0: In the same way, I understand this by inference from the teaching:
ai-dn28:2.9_0: All the perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas—whether past, future, or present—give up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind is firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. They correctly develop the seven awakening factors. And they wake up to the supreme perfect awakening.’”
ai-dn28:2.10_0: All the perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas—whether past, future, or present—give up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind is firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. They will truly develop the seven awakening factors. And they wake up to the supreme perfect awakening.’”
ai-dn28:2.11_0: Sir, the Buddha has given up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind is firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. They truly develop the seven awakening factors. And then he wake up to the supreme perfect awakening.
ai-dn28:2.12_0: Sir, once I approached the Buddha to listen to the teaching.
ai-dn28:2.13_0: He explained Dhamma with its higher and higher stages, with its better and better stages, with its dark and bright sides.
ai-dn28:2.14_0: When I directly knew a certain principle of those teachings, in accordance with how I was taught, I came to a conclusion about the teachings.
ai-dn28:2.15_0: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha. The teaching is well explained. The Saṅgha is practicing well.’
ai-dn28:3.1_0: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches skillful qualities is unsurpassable.
ai-dn28:3.2_0: This consists of such skillful qualities as
ai-dn28:3.3_0: the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakening factors, and the noble eightfold path.
ai-dn28:3.4_0: By these a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-dn28:3.5_0: This is unsurpassable when it comes to skillful qualities.
ai-dn28:3.6_0: The Buddha understands this without exception. There is nothing to be understood beyond this whereby another ascetic or brahmin might be superior in direct knowledge to the Buddha when it comes to skillful qualities.
ai-dn28:4.1_0: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the description of the sense fields is unsurpassable.
ai-dn28:4.2_0: There are these six interior and exterior sense fields.
ai-dn28:4.3_0: The eye and sights, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and touches, and the mind and thoughts.
ai-dn28:4.4_0: This is unsurpassable when it comes to describing the sense fields.
ai-dn28:4.5_0: The Buddha understands this without exception. There is nothing to be understood beyond this whereby another ascetic or brahmin might be superior in direct knowledge to the Buddha when it comes to describing the sense fields.

ai-dn28:5.6_3: This is the fourth kind of conception.
ai-dn28:5.7_0: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the conception of the embryo.
ai-dn28:6.1_0: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the different ways of revealing is unsurpassable.

ai-dn28:6.13_0: And even if they reveal this many times, it turns out exactly so, not otherwise.

ai-dn28:6.19_0: This is unsurpassable when it comes to the different ways of revealing.
ai-dn28:7.1_0: And moreover, sir, how the Buddha teaches the attainments of vision is unsurpassable.
ai-dn28:7.3_0: Firstly, some ascetic or brahmin—by dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus—experiences an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they examine their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-dn28:7.4_0: ‘In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.’

ai-dn28:19.7_0: ‘Reverend Sāriputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening?’ I would tell them ‘No.’
ai-dn28:19.8_0: But if they were to ask: ‘Reverend Sāriputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin at present who has direct knowledge to the Buddha when it comes to awakening?’ I would tell them ‘No.’
ai-dn28:19.9_0: But if they were to ask me,
ai-dn28:19.10_0: ‘Reverend Sāriputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is equal to the Buddha when it comes to awakening?’ I would tell them ‘No.’
ai-dn28:19.11_0: But if they were to ask: ‘Reverend Sāriputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin at present whose direct knowledge is equal to the Buddha when it comes to awakening?’ I would tell them ‘No.’
ai-dn28:19.12_0: But if they were to ask: ‘Reverend Sāriputta, is there any other ascetic or brahmin at present whose direct knowledge is equal to the Buddha when it comes to awakening?’ I would tell them ‘No.’
ai-dn28:19.13_0: But if they were to ask me,
ai-dn28:19.15_0: ‘Reverends, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-dn28:19.16_0: “The perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas of the past and the future are equal to myself when it comes to awakening.”
ai-dn28:19.17_0: Reverends, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-dn28:19.18_0: “The perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas will arise in the future times when I have become fully awakened Buddhas.”
ai-dn28:19.19_0: Reverends, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:
ai-dn28:19.20_0: “It is impossible, it cannot happen for two perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas to arise in the same solar system at the same time.”
ai-dn28:19.21_0: Answering this way, I trust that I repeated what the Buddha has said, and didn’t misrepresent him with an untruth. I trust my explanation was in line with the teaching, and that there are no legitimate grounds for rebuke or criticism.”
ai-dn28:19.22_0: “Indeed, Sāriputta, in answering this way you repeat what I’ve said, and don’t misrepresent me with an untruth. Your explanation is in line with the teaching, and there are no legitimate grounds for rebuke or criticism.”
ai-dn28:20.1_0: When he had spoken, Venerable Udāyī said to the Buddha,
ai-dn28:20.2_0: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! The Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement!
ai-dn28:20.3_0: For even though the Realized One has such power and might, he will not make a display of himself.
ai-dn28:20.4_0: If the wanderers following other paths were to see even a single one of these qualities in themselves they’d carry around a banner to that effect.
ai-dn28:20.5_0: It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! The Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement!
ai-dn28:20.6_0: For even though the Realized One has such power and might, he will not make a display of himself.”
ai-dn28:20.7_0: “See, Udāyī, how the Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement.
ai-dn28:20.8_0: For even though the Realized One has such power and might, he will not make a display of himself.
ai-dn28:20.9_0: If the wanderers following other paths were to see even a single one of these qualities in themselves they’d carry around a banner to that effect.
ai-dn28:20.10_0: See, Udāyī, how the Realized One has so few wishes, such contentment, such self-effacement.
ai-dn28:20.11_0: For even though the Realized One has such power and might, he will not make a display of himself.”
ai-dn28:21.1_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-dn28:21.2_0: “So Sāriputta, you should frequently speak this exposition of the teaching to the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.
ai-dn28:21.3_0: Though there will be some foolish people who have doubt or uncertainty regarding the Realized One, when they hear this exposition of the teaching they’ll give up that doubt or uncertainty.”
ai-dn28:21.4_0: That’s how Venerable Sāriputta declared his confidence in the Buddha’s presence.
ai-dn28:21.5_0: That’s why the name of this discussion is “Sidentle”.
ai-dn28:21.6_0: The fifth sub-chapter on confidence is finished.
